title: What is Artificial Intelligence?
text: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a field of computer science focused on creating systems capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence such as reasoning

title: What is Machine Learning?
text: Machine Learning is a subset of AI that allows systems to automatically learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed.

title: What is Deep Learning?
text: Deep Learning is a subset of machine learning that uses neural networks with many layers to model complex patterns in data.

title: What is Natural Language Processing?
text: Natural Language Processing (NLP) enables computers to understand

title: What is a Neural Network?
text: A neural network is a computational model inspired by the human brain that consists of layers of interconnected nodes called neurons.

title: What is Supervised Learning?
text: Supervised learning is a type of machine learning where the model is trained using labeled data.

title: What is Unsupervised Learning?
text: Unsupervised learning is a type of machine learning that finds patterns in unlabeled data.

title: What is Reinforcement Learning?
text: Reinforcement learning is a training method where an agent learns by interacting with an environment and receiving rewards or penalties.

title: What are Embeddings?
text: Embeddings are dense vector representations of data such as text that capture semantic meaning.

title: What is a Vector Database?
text: A vector database is a database optimized for storing and querying high-dimensional vectors for similarity search.

title: What is Cosine Similarity?
text: Cosine similarity measures how similar two vectors are by calculating the cosine of the angle between them.

title: What is Transfer Learning?
text: Transfer learning is a technique where a pre-trained model is adapted for a new but related task.

title: What is Overfitting?
text: Overfitting occurs when a model learns training data too well
column5: and performs poorly on new data.

title: What is Underfitting?
text: Underfitting happens when a model is too simple to capture underlying patterns in the data.

title: What is Large Language Model?
text: A large language model is a deep learning model trained on massive amounts of text data to generate human-like text.
